messages.subject: Re: [samuraihistory] Kojiro Sasaki
messages.msgSnippet: ... 80´s there was no written documents about Kojiro or his duel with Shinmen Musashi(maybe info change nowadays)some scholars wrote that even today,people on
messages.messageBody:
>Mncoffey asks about Kojiro Sasaki:i dont know these days,but in the
80´s there was no written documents about Kojiro or his duel with
Shinmen Musashi(maybe info change nowadays)some scholars wrote that even
today,people on the area can tell you what kind of clothing he wore on
the day of the duel,but there was no real evidence about him.who
knows?-the sword MnC ask was named "clothing rod",meaning a certain pole
where you can dry out your clothes.regards...Jore

__
Saunalahti Xtra - Uusi GSM-vuokrapuhelin ja edistykselliset Xtra-palvelut käyttöösi alk. 4,95 e/kk! http://saunalahti.fi/xtra/

messages.subject: Kojiro Sasaki
messages.msgSnippet: I was hoping somebody might have some information on Kojiro Sasaki, and if his sword was really named close rod . Any and all information will be very
messages.messageBody:
I was hoping somebody might have some information on Kojiro Sasaki, and
if his sword was really named "close rod". Any and all information will
be very helpful, thanks.-Martin Jr.
